question: In what part of the body is the masseter muscle located?
ideal_answer: In human anatomy, the masseter is one of the muscles of mastication and is located in the jaw.

snippets.text: Intramuscular hemangiomas of the masseter muscle are uncommon tumors and therefore can be difficult to accurately diagnose preoperatively, due to the unfamiliar presentation and deep location in the lateral face.
